Recommandé
12.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 novembre 2013
MirrorMoon è un gioco di esplorazione spaziale dalle ambientazioni surreali; non ci sono nemici da affrontare, ne creature da scoprire: sei TU, la tua piccola ASTRONAVE, la tua STRANA pistola, miliardi di PIANETI e i loro MISTERI da scoprire; l'atmosfera sognante ed incerta, crea uno strana sensazioni tra noi e il mondo che ci circonda, tant'è che anche la risoluzione dei puzzle risulta essere "strana": non capita tutti i giorni di dover "prendere" un pianeta e doverlo spostare dal sole per far apparire dei monoliti invisibili al buio.

Inoltre, la galassia è condivisa nella rete Steam e supportata a Stagioni dagli sviluppatori: quando finiremo di esplorare un pianeta e risolveremo i puzzle, gli daremo un nome...questo, modificherà il nome del pianeta su tutte le MAPPE GALATTICHE di tutti i giocatori di Steam; quando tutti i giocatori avranno completato la galassia conquistandone tutti i pianeti, gli sviluppatori ne pubblicheranno una nuova per ricominciare da capo, sempre diversa e ♥♥♥ nuovi pianeti,colori,forme e puzzle.

Insomma...è un gioco sicuramente da provare, un bell'esperimento sociale e una strana esperienza per l'utente finale; è un gioco casual che sa incollare allo schermo e a trattenerti ore e ore...sarebbe bella l'esperienza Oculus Rift su un prodotto simile...

Purtroppo, è un gioco che va provato per capirlo a pieno; una semplice recensione come questa (o una più completa), non riescono a far comprendere a pieno "come" questo gioco possa sembrare diverso da un qualsiasi altro FPP in circolazione.
 
Darter90 (Retard Diamond)
948 produits enregistrés
1
10 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
8.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 septembre 2014
Saying 'yes' or 'no' to whether I recommend this game somewhat misses the point. It is a world to be immersed in. Unfortunately, rather a great deal of it is boring, simply walking around desolate planets with hardly anything on. And I don't see that it does anything that hasn't been done before. See, for example, Increpare's game 'Cities of Day and Night', available for free from his website. As for the creators of this game (an interview with them can be read at: http://www.rockpapershotgun.com/2013/10/16/the-blind-night-discovering-mirrormoon-ep/), I don't think they're as clever as they would like to think they are. For instance, getting rid of the ability to look up and down is not an innovation, but a nuisance, since as a result one can only see the 'mirror moon' - effectively a map used to help solve puzzles - from very particular angles, which makes solving puzzles difficult, and often ends up in rather tediously walking about in the hope of coming across something. Furthermore, the loading times of levels can be a matter of minutes - and since lots of the moons/planets have so little on them, one wonders why one has bothered. Still further, there isn't really an 'end' to the game, and so any feeling of progression is missing. The game does at least bring up the question of why one would want to explore space if it was so boring.

A far better explorational puzzle-solving game is 'Kairo', which is also far better on story (though it's told in an extremely oblique manner). What value this game essentially has is in showing people that, after a while, less is no longer more.
 
fishorbit
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
12.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 mars 2023
Though I understand the perspective of people who love this game, I think the mixed reception is totally fair. You can go into it ready to be confused and not expecting to have your hand held, like I did, and still not be satisfied. Side A really is cool, but to me it suggested things about Side B that ended up being mostly incorrect.

I wanted to let the game speak for itself, so I didn't look at reviews or guides until after I'd spent a long time on Side B. I made a solid effort to "finish" the game by finding the anomaly, solid enough that the guide I eventually read didn't tell me anything new (except about one non-essential button on the ship). I never did find it, just because I was tired of the process - and especially tired of using the sluggish map controls to hunt down a specific planet that I'd lost track of. Would a simple bookmark system have been too hand-holdy, really?

I wish I had seen the Steam reviews first, because they make very clear something everyone should know: if you've visited something like 10 planets and you're still having fun, then that's cool. But if you're getting bored, you will probably stay bored.
 
Max Keller

4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
7.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 avril 2021
This is definitely going to be in the category of "love it" or "hate it" for most people. This is a game about figuring out what the game is, how the game works and then applying it. You need a lot of patience to get to the end credits without help and the game gives you absolutely no sign posts or hints as to how to get there. You just have to keep your eyes open and repeatedly try things to see what happens. It does lead to some frustration and it can feel a little obscure for the heck of it, but as you become more familiar with it and as it opens out, you'll be surprised by the scale of this game. What started out feeling to me like a couple of half finished proof-of-concept titles roughly stitched together ended up feeling like a deep and pretty satisfying experience that works as a whole. Definitely glad I gave this one a go.
 
Werehare
0
8 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 novembre 2013
MirrorMoon EP is a game that is incredibly hard to describe without spoiling what makes it great, and in my eyes, that makes it incredibly special.

You start in a sort of space ship that makes no sense, and when you fiddle around with it you find yourself on a planet, with a moon. And the moon is a reflection of the planet but not really, and it gets all sorts of complicated from there.

Its up to you to figure out how the game works with minimal instructions, its all up to you to discover the secrets of the massive galaxy, and its up to you to name all these planets.

MirrorMoon EP is a game that feels alive, due to the way that it works. You are actually playing with a whole bunch of other people, working together to uncover every last secret in the galaxy. And when the galaxy has been explored, a whole new one is generated and put online.

Its clever, makes you think, has a great soundtrack, and is incredibly unique. I cannot recommend it highly enough
 
PurpleMoustache
2,889 produits enregistrés
0
7 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
26.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 avril 2014
This game is good for people that like:
Quiet exploration,
Gentle puzzles,
A sense of being distantly connected,
Surrealism,
Slow-paced and self-created visual poetry
Taking screenshots

The puzzles are abstract and simple, but enjoyable. The final puzzle, to locate the Anomaly, gave me a lot of trouble. Now that I have a strategy and know better how the ship visualizes the 3d starfield, I think it isn't nearly as complicated as I thought it was. (I'd be happy to offer hints or tips for how to locate the Anomaly if anyone asks) The game is mostly about enjoying the scenes, music, pastel colors, and general atmosphere. Occasionally a mysterious discovery is an enjoyable change in the otherwise lonely landscape.

The first stage of the game lasts maybe an hour and a half. In that time you'll learn the basic mechanics, visit a few of your first planets, learn the dashboard of the ship, and name your first system. The second stage of the game is learning how the star names work, happening across an observatory, and then using the star map with the constellations to discover where the Anomaly is out of the hundred of stars that are out there. That part might take many hours, but it doesn't really add any more content than the base gameplay.

Games that are similar in style, feel, or gameplay are: Kairo, Fract, Fotonica, The Path, Journey, Proteus
 
GreySpectrum

A beautiful tale of nothing! This game drops you into a mysterious world with not even an arrow pointing you where to go. From the Spaceship which is a mystery in itself you are left venturing the atmosphere in lonely mystery, nothing is handed to you and for that this game is brilliant, you are forced to think on your feet both logically and clever. I would recommend this to those with great patience and a determination to solve the mysteries that lie ahead

Évaluation publiée le 11 avril 2015
Vous aimerez si:
Vous aimez l'espace
Vous cherchez un jeu posay

J'ai tenu 5 minutes à ma première partie parce que je ne comprenais rien aux contrôles, ni à ce qu'il fallait faire.
En y retournant j'ai compris que je ne pourrais rien faire pour les contrôles, mais qu'il y'avait une sorte de logique sur les planètes. A force de creuser, j'ai commencé à comprendre, et c'était vaguement amusant.
Mais en fait, il a suffit d'une mini découverte par un autre joueur pour vraiment lancer la chasse.

Ce jeu nous fait chercher des choses dont on ignore l'existence, personne n'y comprend rien au début, mais ça prend (presque) tout son sens à plusieurs.

Voilà j'ai essayé d'être aussi clair que possible, pas très facile avec ce jeu.
Seul point vraiment négatif: la vitesse de déplacement entre planètes. Quand c'est 30 secondes ça va, quand c'est 15 minutes bah...c'est long !

Évaluation publiée le 1 juin 2021
I give it a thumbs up, but this game is not for everyone!

Do not buy if you look for a story, for graphics, for videos or multiplayer.
Mirrormoon EP is a cryptic puzzle game explaining nothing to the player. You have to figure out everything by yourself. If you are into these kind of games, it offers you a unique experience of space exploration. Trial and error will get you finally to the goal.

If the above statement got you interested, give it a buy during a sale.
 
Internetzer
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0

這是一個在外太空不同星球冒險的遊戲
遊戲的目標好像是要找到各個星球上的遺蹟然後前往下一個星球
有時候天上的月亮就會是你的地圖，你可以控制天上的星球並且打上標記，這樣你在的球上也會有標記
不過這個遊戲的目標說真的很不明確，視角的部分也有一點差強人意
除了畫面很漂亮之外沒什麼出彩的地方

Évaluation publiée le 10 janvier 2015
This game realy inspires me.

I love the sense of mystery around it, at the same time it frustrates the hell out of me.
You just keep going, walking by faith that there is some big secret somewhere , and youl be a the first to find it, then name it.
The music is very beautiful and some of the graphical combinations you come across can be realy pretty.

The only downside is, some planets are too easy, and some are seemingly impossible to unlock/name.

Its also frustrating knowing its by faith you carry on, not being 100% sure of anything. At the same time, thats what makes it so good.

Évaluation publiée le 31 janvier 2016
I don't know if is how the game is supposed to work or if I am a actually got lucky but I have reached the endgame in about 2hr and less then 10 planet visited.

The game is basically a series of not intuitive puzzle and a complex to figure out spaceship control to move from one puzzle/planet to the other.

I was expecting something more like Noctis: a lo-fi procedural generated galaxy exploration game. This game have probably some elements of procedural generation but the planets are basically small balls without nothing but some buildings used for the puzzle, and they look all very similar.

Recommandé
20.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 octobre 2015
MirrorMoon EP est vraiment déroutant. Le jeu nous plonge dans une galaxie étrange, un peu abstraite, où l'on explore des planètes. En y jouant, je ne peux m'empêcher de penser à "2001, l'odyssée de l'espace", car on est partagé entre fascination, et incompréhension. Ce n'est pas un jeu à mettre entre toutes les mains. Certains vont adorer, d'autres vont détester. Il y a quelque chose de poétique dans ce jeu... On ne sait pas si l'on erre bêtement, ou si l'on cherche quelque chose de grandiose. On ne sait pas. On ne sait rien, en fait. On se laisse juste porter, et l'on découvre: comme un nouveau né découvre le monde.
 
pspsps

Recommandé
13.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 novembre 2014
MirrorMoon EP is not a game that will hold your hand. You will not often be rewarded with feedback. You will feel frustrated and lost. You will think you are right, and then be proved wrong. I would not have it any other way.

This game is about searching, failing, and floundering for understanding. If you give up easily, this isn't the game for you. The less you know when you begin, the more profound your journey will be.

Seek the anomaly.
 
wiggle of the worm
174 produits enregistrés
0
6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
3.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 mars 2023
𝕋𝕙𝕖 𝕝𝕒𝕣𝕘𝕖 𝕘𝕒𝕝𝕒𝕩𝕪, 𝕒𝕝𝕥𝕙𝕠𝕦𝕘𝕙 𝕒𝕥 𝕗𝕚𝕣𝕤𝕥 𝕤𝕖𝕖𝕞𝕤 𝕤𝕦𝕡𝕖𝕣 𝕔𝕠𝕠𝕝, 𝕗𝕒𝕝𝕝𝕤 𝕗𝕝𝕒𝕥, 𝕢𝕦𝕚𝕥𝕖 𝕝𝕚𝕥𝕖𝕣𝕒𝕝𝕝𝕪 𝕀'𝕞 𝕒𝕗𝕣𝕒𝕚𝕕.

Don't get me wrong, I'm a sucker for Indie Games... especially when they claim to have a premise as big as No Man's Sky's. MirrorMoon EP will, at first, sound like a great idea: it simulates your spaceship and you go exploring from planet to planet, in a vast universe all your own.

The thing is, these planets contain puzzles, and after a while doing them they will seem more and more repetitive. At first you'd think that you're supposed to visit every one of these small planets to uncover some huge plot, but the reality is there is nothing to be seen there; each planet offers a 2 IQ puzzle, that's a little different in the next planet and the complete same in the third one you'd visit. You can also name planets, but that's not the most challenging part! The most challenging part, believe it or not, is actually figuring out the controls of your spaceship. That's right, the lack of tutorials for this game is astounding. After fiddling with the buttons, I finally started understanding how the ship works; the secret is in the floppy disks, they take you to your destination. All you have to do to 100% the achievements is complete a whole planet on Side A of the map and another one on Side B. That's it, no plot, no narrative... if you want to explore the other hundread of planets, be my guest... but be conscious of the fact that the puzzles are literally the same in each one of them.

All in all, it's a cringe-inducing exploring game with little to do apart from figuring out how the ship works; once you got that down, the rest is so boring you'd rather just play another game. 3/10, just for the ship maneuvering lol
 
Fauxnel
572 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Da ich meist etablierte Spiele zum Vergleich heran ziehe, würde ich diesmal Mario Galaxie wählen, ob es der Spielintension gleich kommt, keine Ahnung. Mario Galaxie, ein Level in der Endlosschleife. Die Darstellungen gehen in Richtung Kunst und Baukasten. Ziemlich mediativ, empfehlenswert auf alle Fälle, zuviel würde ich dafür aber nicht ausgeben, da es etwas flach ist und wenig Tiefgang hat.

The first part is really interesting, the aesthetics are really cool, the puzzles are mind bending and the atmosphere is intriguing; a really good exploratory, immersive experience. But the "second part", when the game world "opens up", is too obscure, too random, too cryptic and it turned out boring for my taste. It's not a game for everyone. Also, the controls and the UI are unconventional, so that can also be a turn down.

Évaluation publiée le 28 septembre 2014
Sadly, I can't recommend this game unless you like this very specific kind of game.

The game is about exploration, you have no "goal". Each place you go to offers you a puzzle to solve. I had lots of trouble figuring out what to do and had to resort to looking at a guide several times, but if you enjoy exploing features then you'll probably enjoy it more than I did. I felt more like I was just pushing buttons to see what happened but never really saw a correlation between action and consequence.

The art looks cool and the games changes the environment around in interesting ways. It did, however, feel like the planets didn't offer much variation as I was fumbling in the dark.

0
Recommandé
19.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 mai 2023
Могу понять смешанные отзывы в магазине Стима. Это одна из тех "странных" игр.
Mirrormoon EP глобально ставит перед игроками одну-единственную задачу: найти местоположение аномалии где-то в космосе. Да, именно *игроками*: несмотря на то, что друг с другом встретиться они не смогут, плоды их работ по исследованию рандомно сгенерированных планет становятся видны всем короткое время спустя. Творение Santa Ragione 2013го года предвосхитило появление No Man's Sky... Шутка, разумеется. Каждая планета представляет собой отполированный шар, от прочих её отличает лишь вариация наполнения загадками.

Итак, в чём суть. Есть трёхмерная карта, наполненная СОТНЯМИ звёзд. И у каждой на орбите - планета, чаще всего со спутником (для удобства буду называть луной). Попав в такую локацию, игрок решает загадку местности, добирается до некоего макгафина - и в награду может как угодно назвать систему, имевшую до этого буквенно-циферное обозначение, вроде JEJ/62. Зачем это нужно? Дело в том, что, помимо обычных планет, очень редко встречаются особые, так называемые обсерватории. Правилом хорошего тона является называть их в духе OBSERV, чтобы люди сразу знали с чем имеют дело.
<< Находясь на планете-обсерватории, игроки видят на небе созвездия и местонахождение аномалии >>
Но что значит "видят"? На небе нет координат. Как можно сказать "ну вот я вижу, аномалия находится в трёх сантиметрах левее такой-то звезды"? Напоминаю, карта ТРЁХМЕРНАЯ, а видит игрок, считай, плоскую проекцию. В итоге, "рядом" расположенные звёзды могут на самом деле находиться вообще на разных концах галактики, просто в масштабах космоса им повезло оказаться почти что на одной прямой относительно наблюдателя.
И вот тут приходит на помощь исследование звёздных систем. Вы видите, что аномалия, обведённая кружком, находится по такой-то оси рядом с созвездием таким-то. А в состав этого созвездия входит звезда, названная кем-то из участников! И вам уже есть от чего отталкиваться. Выйдя с планеты в интерфейс "корабля", вы можете тут же попробовать повращать карту и понять в каком направлении копать дальше. Найдя другую обсерваторию, третью, четвёртую, игроки получают всё больше необходимых сведений для триангуляции нужной точки, сопоставляют карты звёздного неба с уже изученными членами коммьюнити местами, сопоставляют перспективы, пока, наконец, не находят ту самую планету...

Здесь, наверное, мне стоит оборвать свой энтузиазм и рассказать о том, почему эта концепция не подойдёт рядовому игроку.
Как я уже сказал, в игре сотни, если не тысячи, мест для посещения. И, не смотря на то, что разобравшийся с управлением и геймплеем игрок может радоваться первые пару-тройку часов, дальше он неминуемо почувствует, что сюжет как-то не слишком уж и продвигается по сравнению с началом. Условные 36% исследованной карты не торопятся приближаться даже к 50, что происходит и зачем мы всё это делаем... Да, темп игры очень сильно зависит от активности коммьюнити, совершенно немыслимо, чтобы один игрок брал на себя груз ответственности и решал всё сам. Более того, игра это прямо заявляет тебе, введя полоску топлива, восстанавливающегося со временем (например, пока игрок находится на планете) и устанавливая скорость передвижения игрока. Иной раз из точки А в точку Б приходится лететь 3-4 минуты, но при особо дальних перелётах готовьтесь к 16 минутам реального времени! Да, есть возможность установить режим потребления топлива и добраться куда нужно гораздо быстрее, однако опять же, часто прыгать при этом не получится. Эта игра была создана для того, чтобы отвлечься от дел, пройти несколько планет, свернуть игру, пока летишь в новое место, заняться чем-то ещё - ну и в целом, за месяцок сообща разгадка найдётся.
Это не Outer Wilds, здесь нет богатого лора или удивительных находок, это игра про кооперативное решение задачи.

Что ещё есть в ней хорошего? Я сразу заговорил о глобальной цели, упустив локальный кусок геймплея, с которым чаще всего и будет взаимодействовать игрок, без посторонней помощи. Речь о планете с загадками.
И это тот сегмент, который я мог бы посоветовать всем любителям абстракции, потому что абстракция и интуиция - это всё, что будет у вас в этом месте. Кто я? Что я могу? Что я только что сделал? Эта хреновина что-то означает или для красоты? О, а я всегда мог её вращать? Зачем я возвращаю эту приблуду, если я только что её собрал?

Mirrormoon EP, особенно в начале, когда ты даже с интерфейсом "корабля" ещё не разобрался, помещает тебя в ситуацию, где твой жизненный опыт не очень-то сильно тебе помогает, и раз за разом испытывает игрока, добавляя, забирая или комбинируя его возможности воздействия на мир. Где-то твои действия отражаются на зеркальной луне, где-то только благодаря твоим пометкам на луне ты вообще понимаешь, где находишься на планете. Где-то ты можешь её вращать, где-то она неуправляемо летает по орбите, и нужно следовать за ней, чтобы в нужный момент поворота увидеть подсказку. Где-то луны нет совсем.
Дальнейшие планеты будут использовать те же загадки, но либо не давать сразу нужных инструментов, перемешивая последовательность решения, либо вовсе заставляя обходиться чем есть до самого конца.

Как ни странно, в неё всё ещё играют, идёт 118й сезон. Лучшие времена у Mirrormoon стопроцентно позади; впрочем, как представитель неоднозначного жанра в игропроме, она, пожалуй, "всё так же прекрасна, как и в день, когда исчезла".
Ну а для остальных людей, далёких от экспериментаторства, пополнит витрину экспонатов из серии "очень интересно, но играть в это я, конечно же, не стану" :D
 
Sevenecho
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

A.S.K
247 produits enregistrés
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
1.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 juin 2020
I feel like I have to play devil's advocate here because the game has so much criticism levied against it. It's important to realize that MirrorMoon EP isn't a game per-say, so much as it is a zen experience. It very much strikes me as something you put on and play for a while when you're in the mood for it, which admittedly even I can't really play it for extended periods of time.

The game focuses fully on immersion, never telling you what anything does or even what your goal is- curiosity is the main driving motivation. The draw of this game compared to others such as The Witness is that each planet is randomized, meaning that you have infinite places to explore, as well as the ability to name planets you discover ala No Man's Sky. The randomization element is neat in theory, although it is slightly hit-or-miss, as the majority of planets I've discovered so far have been relatively simple to solve and nowhere near as interesting as the hand-crafted tutorial planet you start on. Another criticism brought up is that you can't move your head, which I believe is most likely an intentional, albeit questionable design decision- one of the "puzzles" is determining where you are by looking at a "mirror moon" that is a reflection of the one that you're on, but until you get the ability to carry around said mirror moon with a tool, you have to memorize where you want to go before you have to turn around and lose visibility of the "map"

Overall it feels like a game that rewards people who persevere through its intentionally obtuse controls and gameplay, which again, isn't for everyone. Keep that in mind before buying.
 
Ozzi
365 produits enregistrés
0
7 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

È evidente che il gioco ha sia una solida struttura tecnica, sia artistica, ed il fatto che il team di sviluppo sia italiano mi inorgoglisce non poco.
Questa è solo la mia opinione: i meta-puzzle game non mi sono mai piaciuti.

Non aspettatevi un videogioco convenzionale.

P
1,933 produits enregistrés
2
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
13.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 aout 2020
I'll admit, the entire reson I bought this game was because of your spacecraft which is just a bunch of control consoles that are floating in open space. Surprisingly, each of those screens and controls has an actual purpose which is really neat.

This game is entirely atmosphere, and if you're into that sort of thing or if you just want to relax and relieve some stress, this'll be the game for you. Basically, you just travel around the galaxy in your spaceship and try to find the exit before anyone else does. On each planet there's a little puzzle to solve from a procedurely generated list, and sometimes you'll look up into the sky and see a star which has a circle around it. That's your destination, and you have to extrapolate where you need to go from the stars you can see from the planet's surface onto your navigation console. It's a lot harder than it sounds and you might wind up going to several more locations before you find it even if you see the exit in the sky. You should have pen and paper with you while you're playing if you're reallly invested in getting to the end.

You really shouldn't be though. The ending is nothing much and the point of the game is clearly the journey rather than the destination.
 
ManoutofTime913

Évaluation publiée le 14 mars 2023
If No Man's Sky was a good game and came out 10 years ago.

This one was ahead of its time, actual banger, very confusing at the beginning, but a very nice environment, gameplay and control system once you get the hang of all the mechanics and start travelling from planet to planet.

A very relaxing game, but not for everyone, if you didn't like Death Stranding is highly probably you will dislike this game, but if you like space and planets who knows, give it a shot.
 
Un développeur ou une développeuse a répondu à cette évaluation

まずなにすればいいのかわからない
でもなにかをさせたいんだろうな、ってことはわかるから
それをさがすことになる

うまくいくとなにかがおこるから、うまくいったんだなってことがわかる
とうぜんなにがおこったのかはわからない
そしてつぎにやることをかんがえる

というわけでこれ綺麗なパズルゲーム（多分
銃みたいの持ってるけどSFのFPSではないので間違えないように
そんな人はいないだろうが

2,156 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 décembre 2014
Всем привет!

Приглашаю вас на небольшую экскурсию по игре MIRRORMOON:

Итак, усаживайтесь поудобнее, пристегните ваши привязные ремни, облокотитесь на спинку кресла, стула, или на чем вы там сидите, и наш навигатор отправляется через 3.....2.....1!!! ПОЕХАЛИ!!!!
Мы каждый день задумываемся о том, как была создана наша вселенная, из-за каких условий она возникла? Был ли это сверхмощный внутренний взрыв большой мертвой звезды, либо столкновение ядерных субатомных частиц, вперемешку сверх-массивных черных дыр, или вообще сотворение самим Богом? хмм...весьма интересные вопросы, не правда ли?
К сожалению, эта игра вам об этом не расскажет(
Но, как начало вашего путешествия в путь неисследованного космоса, причин возникновения того или иного на экране, и зачем здесь все эти штуки? В общем вопросов возникает с каждым разом очень много, так что вас окунет головой по полной. Самый первый вопрос, который у вас возникнет при запуске игры - это что за ф...я? Как в нее играть? игра ли это вообще? И ответ конечно будет - ДА - ЭТО ИГРА!!
Игра с умом, логикой, естественностью вещей, от примитивного решения задачи,до муторных копаний в извилинах и ломанием головы об стену, чего делать категорически не рекомендую, думать потом нечем будет). Но давайте начнем по порядку, чтобы голова была на месте, а мозги работали как надо.
Ну-сссс, приступим,
СЮЖЕТ: Игра начинается с того, что вы оказываетесь в открытом космосе, в прямом смысле этого слова. Вокруг мириады звезд сверкают своими холодным, острыми глазами, и вдруг перед вами появляется кабина, нет, не так, что-то на подобии кабины космического корабля, в абстрактном понимании - это кабина, но без стенок, потолка, и пола под ногами. Только перед вами выключенный экран, какие то рычаги, кнопки, селекторы, коннекторы, переходники. У вас сразу появится чувство что-то нового, неизведанного, даже в ступор будет кидать, но не пугайтесь, все приходит со временем и с опытом. Главное не бояться, и нажимать на все кнопки которые отмечены иначе, чем другие, и О-ПА-ЛЯ! Вы уже запустили двигатели(слышатся звук ионных двигателей что ли?), включили экран, увидели навигационную карту, и что-то вроде консолей по бокам, отображающий непонятные символы и цифры. Что-то нажимали, и после яркого света на экране вы оказываетесь на планете. Планета, да, круглая, хотя больше она похожа на гекса-окта-нано-декаэдр, да большая, но как таковых гор, лесов, морей,полей, городов и т.д., вы там не увидите, и скажите в чем смысл тогда, если даже нет ресурсов на планете?
А смысл есть всегда, даже когда его не видно, поначалу.
ГЕЙМПЛЕЙ: Вид в этой игре от первого лица, из инвентаря какая-то штуковина, похожая на грави-пушку, но какая-то иная, с индикатором полос, которые вибрируют и издают характерный звук(или мне показалось что издают)Кому то даже покажется что игра похожа на Portal.
Так вот, нужно понять что делать, зачем ты появился на планете, что это за здания вдали на горизонте виднеются, и что за фоновая музыка играет, может она что-то значит?
А вот дальше уважаемые игроки, думайте головой, соображайте, мыслите, парьте мозг. Ибо, там уже вступает в ход ваша чистая фантазия, которая начинает не по-детски с вами заигрывать в "игру разума".
Тут автоматически включается логика, воображение, интуиция и начинают стрелять импульсы в мозг, и мозг иногда даже закипает от негодования, да вы что? это ведь не реально!!!
Все реально! Каждый объект в этой игре имеет свою секретную функцию, которая за что-то, да отвечает.
НО самое в игре это пожалуй МУЗЫКА, даже не музыка, а задний бэкграунд, так как она как раз и выстраивает всю сцену в игре, она как бы подталкивает игрока к следующему действию, после того как вы услышите характерный звук(иногда мягкий как звук мобильника,иногда резкий как сигнал), игра как бы вам намекает что-то, и вам необходимо догадаться, что же именно произошло. Слушайте, вникайте, думайте. Это игра про звуки во вселенной, что и называется музыкой. Музыкой импульса небесных тел.

СЮЖЕТ: Сюжет вы сами созидаете
ГЕЙМПЛЕЙ: Легкий, ненавязчивый, но чтобы что-то сделать, надо понять как это работает.
ГРАФИКА: Компьютерная ортогональная пикселизация, как в фильме ТРОН- часть первая.
МУЗЫКА: Божественная))

Итого:В результате всех мыслимых и немыслимых подсчетов, я даю игре
8 из 10.

Спасибо разработчикам, за такую неординарную, но интересную игру.
 
F@ceSmasher
0
8 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
1.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 décembre 2013
In the age where narrated tutorials are pretty much mandatory, this game is very refreshing. If you're in the mood for something completely familiar game-mechanics wise, this definitely is not for you.

However, if you like figuring things out on your own and don't mind taking your time, you should get this game. There are no explanations, you have to just figure everything out (and when you begin to do it, you realise it's not as hard as you thought it is). You're told the basic controls and then you're on your own.

It's a rewarding experience that adds replay value in a much more organic way than "some games these days" do it.
 
Myk

5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 mai 2014
You start the game at a mysterious control panel in space. Red buttons are scattered around in front of you. Some of them have obvious functions - turning on displays and interacting with the map - you'll slowly discover the functions of the rest. A disk in front of you has two sides, A and B. A takes you to a tutorial level, B takes you anywhere in the game's universe, which is shared and discovered collectively by you and other players.

The game has good, consistent art style and top-tier music that harmonizes well with it. It's really slow-paced and relaxing. I have a lot of fun just exploring.
 
Tsar Tzeentch

Évaluation publiée le 15 novembre 2017
I understand why people abandon Mirrormoon, but - there is a point to this game, there is an end. It might take a long time for you to figure it out, but that's part of the awesomely atmospheric journey of this game.

If you like minimalist atmosphere, space exploration, light puzzle solving, and inscrutable systems play this.

If you get stuck, the answers are buried in the steam community discussion.
 
incatuple

Recommandé
5.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 septembre 2019
I have rarelly felt as dropped in the maze as in MirrorMoon. Few if no directions, cryptic signals and interfaces, crippled controls (yet necessary sacrifice to the gameplay) and alien design. Yet, the solutions of the problems can often be guessed from observation and fiddeling around gets you somewhere. A sophisticated style for a pure puzzle game.
Don't let your gaming habits get in the way of this extra terrestrial experiennce.

1,714 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
18.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 mai 2020
So simple yet so mesmerising and profound.

As soon as I've started the game I'm immediately out of my depth. No tutorials at the start and that's why it's fun and feels so real. In real life, how many times do you get a new equipment and bothered to read the manual, that is, until you find that fiddling about isn't getting you anywhere then you do pick up the manual - hah! So I'm glad I wasn't given a manual at the beginning because that's how I roll.

I took awhile to understand the very few guides written by other players. To be fair the guides are written clearly without giving too much away. It is your choice whether to use the help or not.

The pure satisfaction of learning from trial and error what each item does is priceless. I rediscovered the joy of not knowing anything and nobody telling me what to do i.e. no quests, no upgrades, no levelling.

When I'm getting close to the finish and no longer just exploring randomly, I know without the game telling me so.

And after I found the anomaly, I felt true satisfaction and nostalgia.

Biggest plus? You can't die in this game.
Minimalist? You bet!
Stuck on a star for too long? Forget it and move on.

My only issue is the brightness when I'm facing the "sun" or when I pick up the orb. Will probably wear sunglasses the next time I play.
 
Tiphy
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
1.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 juin 2018
I get the misterious part to be the planets exploration, where things just appear on the mirror moon because you walked in the right direction or stepped on the right thing, but it's really not fair to have the space ship panel complicated, too. I went back to 2 of my previous found planets just cus of trial and error trying to understand the panel. Why tape? You can call it simulation for the tutorial part. Anyway, it's really clunky to move, and running around in circles for hours might be fun in other games, but definitely not in this one. There's no sense of accomplishment, something to drive me to do it again, repeat the experience. I'm just beamed up back to my ship. Did I discover something? Did I bring back anything with me? Eh. Reviews are mixed for a reason. I wanted to give this a chance, I like challenges, but in the end it's just not fun.
 
Sir SLAM-A-Lot
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
20.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 septembre 2018
This reminded me a lot of an ancient game called Captain Blood - you explore the galaxy solving essentially the same puzzle over and over again, but it's fascinating because it looks and sounds great. It's simpler than Captain Blood but occasionally just as frustrating. Once you get the hang of the interface it boils down to a series of puzzles that involve navigating a small sphere and touching translucent buildings. As a game it wears off rapidly but the music is lovely and it works as a kind of art installation / mood piece. I enjoyed it. At £10.99 it's a bit steep (I bought it on sale).
 
Ayearepee
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 aout 2015
I enjoy this game, and I recommend it to anyone who enjoys puzzle games. That being said, this is no easy puzzle game and is quite abstract. However, solving the puzzles can provide a real sense of accomplishment and that's a major reason I give this game a thumbs up.

The story is minimal and doesn't give you much to go off of. You are the captain of a ship who solves puzzles on planets/stars and names them until you find the Anomaly. What that is, I can't tell you. I have never seen one myself and may never see one. That being said, you'd be lucky to ever find out that's your goal on your own. However, you can really begin to enjoy this game the moment you give up on the goal and take focus on the journey. That is where this game shines.

The first time I reviewed this game was after about 30 min. I felt unengaged and frustrated. I came back to this game after a few months and sat down just looking to do something while I passed the time. That's when I realized when I began to enjoy MirrorMoon EP. If you sit back and just enjoy the puzzles and try to figure out on your own what you're doing, where you're going, and what the goal is, it's a lot more fun than thinking about the actual progress you're making.

Serious puzzle game fans will get a lot of enjoyment out of MirrorMoon EP, but few others will enjoy the very abstract and open-ended nature of it. Nonetheless, I enjoy this game and think it's well done, even if sometimes I feel lost or a little hopeless.

Overall, nice visuals, good sounds, and engaging puzzles. It had everything it should and it works really well.

As a side note: the game has "seasons". The game is connected online, but you'll never interact with anyone else in a direct way. Once somebody reaches the end goal of the game though, then the new season starts. Everything is fresh again and you're off to complete the goal once more. This makes it fun to come back to every now and again for a new chance at finally beating it. You may just get lucky.

6/10
 
Shyny Magikarp
619 produits enregistrés
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0

Évaluation publiée le 12 aout 2015
Je trouve que cette version payante du jeu "Mirror Moon" n'apporte que trop peu de chose par rapport à la première vesion gratuite du jeu. J'aime beaucoup le gameplay et la direction artistique de Mirror Moon, et c'est ce qui m'avait convaincu d'acheter cette version complète. Mais comme je l'ai dit, cette dernière n'apporte que des niveaux extrêmement répétitifs et l'exploration des planètes devient rapidement TRES ennuyante. Mon conseil : téléchargez la première version gratuite du jeu, l'essentiel y est déjà.

Évaluation publiée le 29 janvier 2015
Presi questo videogioco perché mi aveva colpito sinceramente, mi era piaciuto il paesaggio minimale e dai colori saturi; la sua atmosfera misteriosa e surreale in un avventura esplorativa nello spazio... Se ci fosse stato solo qualche errore avrei chiuso un'occhio in favore dell'esperienza in se, ma MirrorMoon EP, purtroppo, ha l'errore più imperdonabile di tutti del mondo videoludico: non da informazioni/intuizioni al giocatore per procedere, è una buona idea nel suo complesso ma questo non è un "puzzle game" fatto ♥♥♥ dei giusti criteri, siamo nella stessa situazione del più recente "Baldo: The Guardian Owls, per intenderci.

Recommandé
7.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 février 2014
When purchasing this game, it is important to note that there will be no hand holding, you are litreally dropped into a moon that has mysterious properties. But thats okay, as you slowly become mystified by the puzzles and strangeness that accours as you work though the puzzles of the moon. After you are finshed, you are placed in a strange spaceship, and without any guidance, allowed to explore a galaxy of strange and surreal starsystems, in seach of an anomaly.

The game has wonderful ambient music, and if you are like me, satsifies the urge to explore unknown dephts, all whilst enjoying a bizzare minimist approch to art, where block colours and glow are the only tools used.

This game is a great little gem which you will spend a good amount of time just walking on moons taking in the enviroment without realising you shoudl probbably be solving a puzzle, but this game is defintly not for those who prefer having direction in thier games.
 
Megamammoth
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
9.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 février 2014
Ok let me have a go at this. You're on a moon, with another moon oribiting you. Actually, the orbiting moon is a mirror of the moon you're on an you can see yourself on it. In fact, you can get a gravity gun and move the moon in the sky, in essence moving the moon you're on. You're trying to build a bridge between the two moons, so you can meet yourself (I guess); paradoxes be damned.

In gameplay terms, the game consists of two major puzzles (beginning and end) with space navigation in between to find the correct planet to end the game. The game has "seasons" where a blank starmap is commenced and gamers "name" stars in an effort to help each other find the end planet. However in reality the navigation map is not very useful as it is quite huge and translating observations to the map is not easy, you'll end up mostly randomly hopping planets with the hope that you stumble upon the correct one. The game doesn't tell you much, but with a few trial and error, you'll figure out what to do.
 
Ralgaoud
987 produits enregistrés

2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Évaluation publiée le 11 juin 2014
I liked the general feel and atmosphere of the game, but disliked the limitations of the controls and that all planet puzzels where only smaller variations of the first one. This is not a game for everyone but I liked feeling like an explorer finding new starsystems and naming them In a desolate and empty world.

Recommandé
8.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 mai 2015
Déroutant... Vous êtes largués dans un cockpit étrange. Vous tapotez partout au hasard, puis vous êtes téléportés sur une planète, avec des structures éparses, des items à collecter et à expérimenter pour comprendre leur intérêt. Vous ne comprenez rien, vous testez tout et n'importe quoi. Il se passe des "choses", que vous ne comprenez pas, puis vous finissez par aboutir à une séquence qui sent la victoire... mais qu'il faudra qu'on m'explique un jour. Félicitations, vous avez fini le tutoriel !

Fort de mon expérience, ayant dégagé quelques principes, je suis alors parti à la conquête d'autres planètes, un peu au hasard de la map. Pas de chance, la première semblait buguée... ou alors quelque chose m'a échappé (ce qui est très possible). J'ai failli arrêter, puis j'ai exploré une autre planète - que j'ai "conquis" - et que j'ai nommé. Puis 2, et 3...

Le principe est sympa, mais y jouerais-je plus ? Je ne sais pas. Si il s'agit juste d'explorer des planètes comme je l'ai fait, je m'arrête là. Ce n'est pas désagréable, mais passé le premier nommage de planète, ce n'est plus gratifiant. Si par contre il y a quelque chose à chercher, qu'il y a un objectif à plus long terme, une enquête ou je ne sais quoi, une coopération avec les autres joueurs, je pourrai m'y mettre. Il y a forcément quelque chose, c'est évident. Mais quoi ? Le potentiel de quelque chose de très grand en tout cas, ça c'est certain. Mais voilà, le jeu est avare en infos. Ca fait son charme au début (je conseille de se démerder pour comprendre par soi-même). Sauf que maintenant je ne veux absolument pas lire de spoilers qui pourraient gâcher mon plaisir, mais je ne veux pas errer sans but dans l'espace des heures durant. J'ai des tonnes d'autres jeux à tester, donc j'arrête pour aujourd'hui. Un jour peut-être...
 
sey

Évaluation publiée le 18 juillet 2015
チュートリアルで基本的な1人称視点での操作を学び
宇宙船でのパネル操作へ何の説明も無く突入。
説明書読まずに新しい家電とかを弄る感覚。

ゲーム自体は単調。
基本的には星へ行きその星のパズルを解く。
そしてゴールとなる星を探し出せれば終わり。

空間認識能力がある程度あると苦労はしないかも。
基本はMirrorMoonさえ念頭にあれば星のパズルは大丈夫。

Évaluation publiée le 19 novembre 2014
An amazing space exploration game, in the tradition of Myst where you must figure out both what and how. Fantastic art and truly abstract music, which blew me away and fits the game well.

The end game can get a bit tedious after you've figured out what's going on, but somehow it still keeps you sucked in until the wee hours of the morning.

0.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 avril 2015
I can definitely see why a lot of people would not enjoy this game, but, personally, I love it. This game is unique, and incredible. The puzzles are different from any other game I have played, and yet somehow they feel so intuitive. Mirror Moon brings you into the age of space exploration. You will wander the universe, and discover fun puzzles along the way. The environments are low-poly, and somehow they still contain a striking beauty in their simplicity. I have yet to get stuck on a puzzle, and quite frankly if you cannot solve most of the puzzles in this game fairly easily you are either unlucky or you're really missing a detail there.
 
Sorrien
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
7.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 décembre 2013
Is it space that I'm exploring in this game, or something else? Something touching on the metaphysical?

If (like me) you are the kind of person who is willing to pay money for something of which you think "good or bad, this should be interesting", then I can wholeheartedly recommend this game for the opening level alone. Messing around in the spacecraft is good too, so try that as well. It makes space feel simultaneously agoraphobic and claustrophobic.

For better or worse, this is a game that tries to give its player something that they could not have looked for. It therefore does not try to be "fun" per se. This is pure exploration of the utter unkown. You are told nothing but the title, and what's out there is up to you not only to find but to interpret. If you want a game that explains itself to you and lets you get busy having fun, this is not it. If you are in the mood for a game that is itself a puzzle and a mystery, get this now.

I don't know whether I will ever launch this game again, but I found the experience powerful and haunting.
 
Sleeping Yeti

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
14.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 aout 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

Il gioco è diviso in due parti(chiamiamole parte A e parte B) e in entrambe le parti è fondamentale capire come funziona la console di viaggio interstellare.
Parte A (single player): una volta comprese le basi sull'interfaccia di navigazione ci ritroveremo catapultati su un pianeta senza un motivo apparente, e dovremo avere a che fare ♥♥♥ dei rompicapo per poter progredire nel livello.

Parte B (multyplayer): la parte A non era altro che un tutorial ben fatto per il vero gioco, per farti prendere confidenza ♥♥♥ le varie meccaniche che puoi trovare visitando i pianeti nel multy-verso. Ora avrai la possibilità di visitare miriadi di pianeti (senza un motivo apparente) ONLINE; questo NON significa che troverai altri giocatori in giro per lo spazio(peccato), tuttalpiù potrai rinominare i pianeti visitati, capendo se un pianeta è stato già visitato o no. Questo sarà fondamentale per arrivare al vero obbiettivo del gioco.

Vero obbiettivo del gioco(SPOILER): lo scopo della parte B è di trovare il pianeta "anomalo" ovvero l'anomalia riscontrata alla fine della parte A. Un ago in un pagliaio se non si sà come cercarlo. Nel mezzo dei tuoi viaggi interstellari potrai trovare dei pianeti da cui si vede una stella cerchiata. Quella è l'anomalia. Di solito su questi pianeti si trova uno "star map artifact" che sbloccandolo ti permetterà di vedere le costellazioni, così da riuscire ad orientarti per trovare il pianeta anomalo. E qui entra in gioco la componente multyplayer. Infatti i giocatori possono aiutarsi tra loro rinominando i pianeti in modo che sia intuitiva la presenza di uno star map artifact(Obsrv) o addirittura rinominare l'anomalia stessa(Anomly).
(FINE SPOILER)

La parte B è fatta apposta per essere discussa sui forum ♥♥♥ altri giocatori, è impensabile scoprire tutto questo da soli, io stesso dopo 14 ore spese a vagare mi sono posto due domande mosso a disperazione.

PRO: un precursore di No Man Sky in stile minimal, senza perdere l'atmosfera alienante dello spazio, anche grazie ad un bellissimo sound. La dedizione nei dettagli è profonda e direi che è proprio questo il punto di forza di questo gioco, oltre al fatto di essere italiano. Gran parte del divertimento è capire come funziona la console.

CONTRO: Gran parte del """divertimento""" è capire come funziona la console. Per quanto i pianeti siano diversi tra loro, lo sono solo per combinazione di enigmi, tra l'altro secondari. Non è di sicuro un gioco vario, tutto ripetitivo. Preciso che i pianeti sono in realtà delle lune, in 30 secondi di cammino hai compiuto un'intera rotazione(non aspettatevi pianeti immensi). 14.99€ non li spenderei mai per questo gioco salvo in rare eccezioni(tipo supportare il made in Italy).

Lo consiglio a chi è interessato a sfidare il proprio intuito e intelletto nello scoprire i misteri delle meccaniche, ma comunque non lo prenderei a più di 5 euro. Link al gameplay ignorante della parte A fatto ♥♥♥ amici alle loro prime armi.

Vidéo YouTube™: Mirrormoon Ep Gameplay Full HD Parte 1, Un gioco DELIRANTE! 
Vues : 127
Oggi parliamo di Mirrormoon EP, bellissimo gioco che necessita un quoziente intellettivo sopra la norma per essere compreso appieno.

Évaluation publiée le 23 avril 2014
Maybe I have not spent enough time with this game, and maybe I will in the future. However, the controls on this game are distracting. I understand that the controls are designed to make you interact with the environment in a very different way. I completely understand what they are trying to do here, but it really takes away from enjoying the surreal environments that the developers have created. These environments are a little distracting as well. I completely love minimalistic design, but minimalism does not equal simplicity. I think the environments are over-simplistic and does more to distract that contribute to the overall concept. One day, I had an urge to play an experimental title. I chose this one to satisfy my craving. I should have chosen better.

0.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 mars 2016
This game is about finding how to play the game. And that pretty much sums it up. You start off on a planet and you know how to move with WASD and thats all the game tells you. You can't move your viewpoint with the mouse and you can't strafe. Why? because "exploration" There is no tutorial except people say that there is one. You have 2 points of view on a planet and on your ship. When on your ship there is a floppy drive with a A side and a B side apparently the A side is the tutorial and the B side is the main game. How do you know this? well you need to look it up. Its fun to find your own way through things but not when you need to discover everything yourself.

...I don't get it. I'm sorry. I can only wonder if there's really a point to the whole thing, or if this is some kind of hoax. If there's a point when everything in this game starts to feel rewarding and intriguing, I haven't found it yet, and I'm too discouraged to try it any further.

TL;DR: You might like this but you'd better have a lot of patience on hand.

4.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 mai 2015
This game is so hipster that:

Arcade Fire listens to it.
It was delivered to Steam servers by a courier knit in a cap on a fixed gear bicycle.
It will order organic Ugandan fair-trade coffee with low fat soy and no foam while you run in circles on a planet.
It wears pants so tight, any tighter would be a singularity.

But honestly the "game" is mostly procedural, and that itself leaves a lot to be desired as the puzzles (planets) end up being uncurated messes that are sometimes literally just exits you spawn next to. Interesting concept, aimless otherwise, rather boring, vague.
 
Auburok
1,489 produits enregistrés

Recommandé
13.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 février 2014
I have not played much of this game, so far. Although there is no doubt that I will be playing more.

From what I have gathered so far:
MirrorMoon, a position of which one is in a place, on a moon, in-between a scaled size map which is actually another physical moon than can be moved over the coinciding sun. This causes a quick swift darkness to ensue. It also changes the contents, now things which were originally not there in the day, where there in the night. There are ancient like artifacts, all with there own unique design, that coordinate together as components of a larger puzzle. Many people discuss them as if they are left over from some ancient civilizations, but i think they are something else. Maybe, they are universe anomalies. Things that exist in places where they shouldn't. They are mistakes of the universe's natural laws in action. Buildings incomprehensibly positioned, unquestionably structured in contradiction to the natural laws that govern atomic interactions. You see, the game is called MirrorMoon, and no reflection is perfect.

This game is peculiar. Its a game that, when being played (in that present moment) is awe-inspiring servitude to our ancient-deep driven quest for discovery. It plays on an instinctual quality of our species. It dazzles our eyes, to provoke our attention. Then it immerses you further into itself, so that you would be forever lost in the ambiguous quest to know what the ♥♥♥♥ is going on. I like the idea that, in this game, you give yourself direction. From that action, determination builds and it rolls upon itself.

With all this in mind, you should be patient. You don't run into a dark room in which you know nothing about. One step at a time, one button at a time, and soon the room will be totally seen, even in the darkness.

There is still much to do...I'll probably update this review as I go on. Although, playing one hour and provoking this much, I'd say you got yourself a winner here.
 
TiKiGoD

Recommandé
3.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 avril 2015
_Te has perdido??
_No estoy dando una vuelta por la galaxia.

Ayer leyendo sobre este juego lei algo así como "los desarrolladores no actualizan los mapas hasta que los jugadores no han descubierto TODAS LAS ESTRELLAS" y me recorrió un escalofrio por el cuerpo.

A los que lo juegan (no se si este juego puede engancharte y dejarlo), yo me lo estoy tomando como las drogas duras, solo para experimentar... esto que he dicho me imagino que les sacará una medio sonrisa, a los que están mirandolo por primera vez les ayudará de muy poco...

A ver este juego Duele, a mi personalmente me pone mal cuerpo, es como ver DUNE ♥♥♥ mucho sueño, sin dialogos y solo ♥♥♥ los fx de sonido y la banda sonora...

Estás SOLO, pero ostias, solo como no te has visto en otro juego en tu vida, y el sonido te recuerda a cada segundo, que estás solisimo, explorando...


Que te vas a encontrar?.

Los gráficos siendo una basura, no podrían ser mejores. No se puede hacer gráficamente este juego mejor, es un tope, ponerle cosas lo empeoraria, quitarle lo haria desaparecer.
Sonido y musica: (conoce alguien a la chica de los mofletes tumorosos dentro del radiador en eraserhead de lynch) no me veo capaz de hacer una critica "seños no soy digno de que entres en mi casa..."
Modo de juego: Jajajajajajajajajajajaja a quién le gusta ganar??.
[ehhhh]: Momento más repetido del juego.

Hoy he visto un titulo por ahí. "Dont touch anything", el titulo me ha hecho grácia. Quizás es lo que habría que hacer ♥♥♥ este juego para ser sinceros ♥♥♥ uno mismo, en el momento de empezar no pulsar nada, solo quedarse esperando... Estático en silencio.

9.9/10 Las instrucciones no vienen en español


jajajajajaja

Non recommandé
0.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 février 2014
Tedious, shallow, eye-aching crud. A normal title screen would be a good start. Completing a so-called 'puzzle' leaves you with zero satisfaction due to the absolute lack of any known parimeters. Without all its indie-design, Mirror Moon EP is suitable perhaps for people who want to click & press buttons mindless until a small thing happens; at which point the following test will be to click something else at random. I thought I would enjoy the aesthetics of this game at least, which is why I got it, but it is incredibly limited. Mirron Moon EP is art-for-arts sake and perhaps only suitable for those who enjoy collecting indie games, because this is certainly not one for gamers or even someone looking for something different or intelligent.

Évaluation publiée le 17 aout 2015
un buon gioco basato sull'esplorazione e semplici puzzle.
il tutorial (Side a) è a mio parere meraviglioso. il side b ovvero il gioco vero e proprio può risultare troppo dispersivo e tutt'altro che semplice ♥♥♥ un gran rischio di annoiarsi. senza l'aiuto della comunità attraverso i forum o attraverso i pianeti già nominati da altri il gioco può protrarsi tantissimo, troppo. all'inizio lascia spaesati, comandi non spiegati e una navicella tutt'altro che semplice da capire al primo colpo, ma mi sono divertito molto a giocarlo. il finale lascia l'amaro in bocca, deludente dopo tanta ricerca. consigliato per la sensazione di solitudine nell'immenso spazio realizzata più che bene.

Recommandé
1.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 janvier 2017
It's too bad steam doesn't have a 'shrug' hand gesture, because recommending this game is entirely about what sort of things you enjoy. Just take a look at the screen shots and ask yourself if "artst fartsy" is your thing (the movie "Beneath the Skin" and "Beyond the Black Rainbow" come to mind). Combine that with some 'no hand holding' puzzle solving and if you're still with it, then this game is really worth checking out.

It doesn't crash, runs great and the controls work perfectly for what they need to do. So the quality and care are there, and with the originality it brings, it earns itself a positive review.

A quick note after looking at some other reviews:
I can see why this game gets mixed reviews, because quite a few things feel antiquated and backwards, where the mouse controls a moon that at first seems like a map and the keys are ol skool wolvstine feeling. But stick with it. I said the controls worked well for what the game was aiming for because there are reasons, including how the moon might "seem" like a map at first.
 
disco

Recommandé
7.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 avril 2015
Oh, MirrorMoon EP. Well, let me first start off that this game isn't for everyone. I recieved the game through a HumbleBundle purchase and seemed like a cool concept to try out. Started this game at 6 a.m. and completed it 100% 7.6 hours later. I was confused as hell what to do in the game in the begginning, until I researched video's and discussions about the general gist of the game and decided, "Here goes nothing."

I was able to start the panel first try and popped in the Side A floppy diisk which ported me into a planet that seems to be the "Tutorial Mission". Takes you roughly 10 minutes to complete and realize that it is a puzzle game without any instructors, freeing your imagination. Once completing the "Tutorial Mission", the floppy disk turns over to Side B giving you the general content of the game. You must travel in light speed from Star to Star and discover unnamed ones that you can call it whatever you wish. The core concept is to find planets with constellations in the sky that give you a map to where the "End game" level is.

When playing on the online part of the game, you actually work with everyone in that "Season" to discover stars and locate the "End Game" star. Very simplistic game that does not explain itself nor should it have to. If you want a game that tells you everything on what to do and what the plot/concept/end result is, then you have no creatvity nor want to explore. After all, this is a Space Exploration Puzzle Game.

In my opinion. I would rate it:
8/10 for Creativity
9/10 for Simplistic (No Man Sky) feel Graphics and Atmostphere.
6/10 for Online Content and Story

Overall, a solid 7 or 8 in my book. Doesnt hurt to purchase the bundle now and recieve 7 games for 6 bucks (about 80 cents a game people!) to try this bad boy out. Other than that, I would wait for sales and the price to go down to below 5 bucks.
 
DanieltheDemon

Non recommandé
0.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 avril 2015
This game relies far too much on what the developers assumed players would get out of it. From the very start of the game, there's already horrible assumptions that would only make sense in very limited player contexts. For example, the cockpit the player starts out in has controls all over the screen, but the player is arbitrarily limited to only what is red for the purpose of an implied tutorial. The game doesn't actually clarify that the player is supposed to mess with the red things, or that the color is of particular importance beyond aesthetic. It just assumes players will care more about color than complexity or function and immediately mess with the red thing. I'm not exaggerating this point. I literally wondered if the game was not working because nothing I clicked or tried to drag did anything until I happened to click on the red thing. After that, the game only got marginally better at making things clear.
 
kimiyoribaka

Non recommandé
7.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 aout 2016
I think the downfall for me was the exploration. Worlds are pretty much identical, and the puzzles on them aren't puzzles. I liked the end, but the vast majority of time is spent in a pointless, absurdly boring, grind. I mean, most of what you do in this game is wander around the surface of an ugly ball, looking for ugly structures. Then you move the ugly moon to reveal more ugly structures, all of which would fit onto a flow chart drawn by a five year old - and somehow this qualifies as "exploration."

The final puzzle was nicely hard - but still more a grind than anything, and not enough to save this otherwise godawful boring game.

Graphic style: 3/5 (Qwirky, CGAish)
Puzzle quality: -1000/5
Replayability: NEVER AGAIN
Recomendablility: ABSOLUTLY NOT
 
AnUnusedMoniker

Can't recommend it but i guess if you are really really really into puzzles and space exploration maybe you might like it who knows? I got it in an Humble Bundle so can't complain too much.

Évaluation publiée le 21 octobre 2017
MirrorMoon is obtuse.

Even muting audio is an unlabelled button. But messing around and completing Side A is a fun exploration of orienteering-based puzzle solving. Worth a try, but probably not for $20. I got this in some bundle, so it was worth it for me.

Side B seems to be filled with badly procedurally generated worlds (not always having the right pieces). I think it's meant to be solved/explored collaboratively, so too late for that.
 
idbrii

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
0.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 juillet 2015
Games like these are an effective test of my capacity to review a game.

MirrorMoon EP, in short, is an art game, about discovery.

Because of this, it goes out of its way to obfuscate the controls and user interface in an artistic way, which I personally understand but find both intriguing and irritating. From what I can tell, the game is designed to be an open-ended experience to have from time to time, instead of accomplishing it in any definite or predictable way.

If you're up for that sort of thing, then you might have a great time here. I really enjoyed the visual aesthetics of MMEP as someone who likes rather minimalistic art from time to time.

I'd definitely say part of the experience is figuring out how the hell to do anything in the game, however. Feel free to take that as either a challenge or a warning.

I can easily see why some would be annoyed, and although there are a couple of Community Guides already there's definitely a part of me which is intimidated by the concept of an exploration game which forces you to understand a skeuomorphic user interface for both the ship and environment. Thing is, outside of procedurally-generated planetary exploration that's basically the point of the game to me, so I can't really be that upset about it.

I'd recommend it for an experience unlike most others, especially the ship's interface with all of its buttons and gizmos, but the game definitely defies what I consider conventional game design so if you're looking for that you're out of luck, I'm afraid.

Overall, I'd recommend it, especially at its current price point (during a Humble Store sale) of 2 bucks.
 
arbayer2
0

Évaluation publiée le 7 juillet 2014
Absolutely fantastic. I have played hours of this game on my Fire TV, and I just found out it was on Steam as well. This is an atmospheric first-person puzzler that perfectly emulates a genuine sense of lonely, aimless exploration through space. To access this however, you have to figure out the cryptic controls of your spacecraft and the mysterious objects you find on planet surfaces.

Évaluation publiée le 21 juin 2014
While the mechanics of this game is nice, it is way too abstract and barebone, lacking anything remotely resembling characters (which is ok), a story (which is forgivable) or a world (which is bad). A travel through a world of abstract shapes feels nice until you realise that there is nothing beyond them. It's just a large virtual installation made of unending coloured rectangles. Some may find this meditative, I find it hollow.
 
thainen

2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
17.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 février 2014
A lot of things out there try to fit into some category....MirrorMoon doesn't really fit into any of them, and it's unsettling. Upon entering the game I had no idea what anything was, what anything did, where I was, what I was doing, or why I could magically control a moon in the sky which was at the same time the moon I was also standing on (and I still don't know lol). It's unsettling in a really good way.

I guess it might be somewhat of a puzzle and exploration game, but it quietly walks past most of the "hallmarks" of those categories and it might be more apt to describe it as an experience game, simply put. People who want some kind of clear focus and interaction might not find what they're looking for here. It's been compared to the game Antichamber (although I've never played it) and Dream to some extent, and those connections make sense in certain ways.

Playing this game reminds me a lot of the feeling of listening to some 15 minute long ambient drone music, enjoying the subtle patterns and tones. Or of the feeling of watching a film, such as the Koyaanisqatsi trilogy, where the mind gets lost in the images/music and moves outside of itself. There isn't a definite purpose to the game, it's open ended and mysterious and technically never-ending via the seasons system. I feel like maybe all of that somehow mirrors some essential truth about real life. Either way, it's a real keeper.
 
-||cherohala||-

1.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 janvier 2014
An artsy independent project that some would argue isn't a "game". If you liked games like Proteus that rely more on tone than action and exposition, this will definitely be up your alley. The tone of the game is very opaque and mysterious. Definitely not for everyone, but I really appreciate the style and the experience of figuring out how your ship works without any handholding.

Évaluation publiée le 7 octobre 2015
A load of pretentious shovelware.

The game involves pushing random buttons and walking around on some barren rock with no idea what to do. It is not even a good walking simulator as there are only two or three colours on screen at one time and almost no scenery to look at. You have to use the keyboard to turn around because the mouse seems to rotate the mirror planet in the sky, so the controls are absolute rubbish.

0/10. Would not wish this game on an enemy.

Évaluation publiée le 1 septembre 2020
I originally left a negative review because like many players I was frustrated by the complete lack of guidance. Now after many years I just came back and beat the game in approximately 16 hours of playtime.

I've got to say that MirrorMoon EP is very rewarding. It is a very unique and inspiring experience, but you have to have the right focus and be in the right mood to enjoy it.

At first it's a relaxing puzzle game, but to complete the game it takes dedication and ingenuity. When you finally reach the anomaly you will be happy you went all the way!

Évaluation publiée le 14 mai 2016
FPS惑星探索ゲー
大量にある星を自由に探索して謎を解き、１つ１つ攻略していきます
オンライン要素があり、世界ではじめてその星を攻略した人は名前をつけられます

というと聞こえはいいが、実際のところ星の移動の仕方もよくわからないし
それぞれの星の謎解きもほとんど同じでつまらない
謎解きよりも、広い星を歩きまわって目的地にたどり着かない時間のほうが長いし、
目的の星に向かって宇宙船を移動させて到着を待つ時間のほうがもっと長い
ほとんどが待ち時間のゲームです。

でもチュートリアルは本当に面白かったです。
チュートリアルだけおすすめ

Évaluation publiée le 8 janvier 2015
This game basically consists of two parts:

(a) Travelling through space by pushing buttons and inserting Amstrad CPC discs in a device called Multivac EP3.
(b) Exploring planets, which is sort of a trippy SF version of the desert scene in Wayne's World 2 (lacking Jim Morrison and weird naked Native-American guides, though).

Certainly kinda fun (at least for a few hours I guess), but I still prefer aimlessly walking around in RL.

Évaluation publiée le 8 janvier 2014
Promises exploration and discovery, but every planet is the same, the puzzles are all the same, and after visiting 100 planets that are just variations on the same pattern, it gets boring. There's nothing to see, nothing new to do, and it's nearly impossible to find your one goal star among the hundreds of other stars in the galaxy. It comes down to just luck, not deduction or skill. Exploration feels more like a chore than an adventure. I did not have fun with this.

Évaluation publiée le 5 novembre 2013
Ok so the reason i picked this up is well its on sale. I love indie games. I love space. I love puzzles. This is a really strange and uniqe game. I love it. :) Ok the best explaination for this game is well you have a spaceship that you use to find moons and planets. Once on the said moon or planet you have a type of tool i wouldnt call it a gun cause it doesnt shoot bullets or what have you. You need to explore and discover different parts of the moon my picking up attachments for your "gun" this will allow you to manipulate the moon and activate beacons and to solve bassically the puzzles. Its a story that builds on itself as you complete the different moons. this is deffidently unique and i recommed those who like puzzles and being challenged to pick this game up. Its not your average game so if it doesnt look cool or interesting dont bother with it. i like it cause well im different and like to be challenged from time to time. Peace
:P

3.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 septembre 2013
I picked this game up a few days ago and gave it a try just now. The first thing that caught my eye was the intro: it gave me this feeling of lonliness. After that, it just dropped me into the first level with barely so much as a clue to what to do. That aside, I found that the exploring the first planet was a treat in itself: the contrast of colors, good use of tone, and the music was very atmospheric. I'd encourage you to play with headphones.

In the end I still have much more to try with this game (given they don't tell you much). Simple mechanics, fun puzzles, but a lot to grasp from the get go. 8/10.

Évaluation publiée le 9 juillet 2020
I'm not sure what I expected from this game, but I got none of it.

Normally I look into games pretty heavily before buying them, but some reason I picked this one up because:

1. The cover images they used had a cool art style

Turns out the, the game doesn't even freakin look like that. Instead of being cool minimalism art like their promotional images, it's just flat low poly garbage. I guess I should have looked at the screenshots more closely.

2. I like exploration games, which is what this appeared to be

It ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ is not. This is a puzzle game pretending to be an exploration game and is so incomprehensible that it requires the work of completing a PhD thesis to play it. I don't even mind a good puzzle game, but there's nothing to even grasp onto here to start putting the pieces together.

Honestly, it's probably my fault for buying a game without looking into it more first, but I really didn't like anything about what I saw.

Recommandé
5.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 février 2014
Being a marginal fan of games that possess no instructions and require a certain amount of trial and error, this is a perfect game. To your average <12 COD, FIFA etc. addict, you probably will want to play this game to expand your mind to the possibilities of a game not only without words, but a game that allows you to name stars by being the first clever clogs to unlock whatever it is you are supposed to do. There are only a handful of mechanics involved in the puzzles, but dozens of combinations, meaning that every planet(moon?)fall is a scramble of wits to ascertain that locations own unique set of rules.
In summary: MirrorMoon is a bit different to nearly everything else and is well worth getting when it is cheap.
 
bunnyfrog the uncivilized

2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
18.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 mars 2017
I actually did enjoy this game to an extent but if im being sensible, its hard to recommend the experience it offers.

The goal is to travel across the galaxy seeking the "anomaly", a single planet among hundreds that once found ends the game. Each planet has a short puzzle to solve that results in you collecting a white orb to leave the planet, name it, and move on to another destination.

Rgearding the positive aspects, the simple visuals are undeniably pretty and partnered with a beautiful ambient soundtrack thats fits the space setting well.

The biggest issues MirrorMoon suffers are its repetitiveness and its tedious travel mechanic. The most complex puzzle you solve is during the tutorial at the start of the game and every puzzle you encounter on every other planet is a subtle variation on it. You'll realise this after twenty or so planets and its becomes a chore to repeat the same process with a few more or less steps. The most exciting thing you may encounter during this is a clue as to the location of the anomaly planet, ringed in the sky (not all that helpful really) or a peculiar structure/object on the planet (that does nothing). But most of them are virtually empty besides the structures needed to solve the planets puzzle.

The travelling is straight up terrible. Depending on the planet you choose to head for you can be travelling between twenty seconds up to ten minutes, but usually at least a minute or two with literally NOTHING to do. I found myself hitting the windows button and browsing websites while i waited for my ship to arrive. Not exactly an engrossing experience. Its like playing a game for 2 minutes and waiting for a 2 minute loading screen for the next map each time.

I put the time i did into this for the sake of finding the anomaly but it doesnt exactly pay off. Try The Path instead.

 
TheYellowFlan
1
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 aout 2016
This game confuses me, but in a positive way. I kind of wish there was a tutorial on how your pod works, because I'd rather be exploring other planets rather than randomly flipping switches and mashing buttons for 5 minutes. I mean sure, the game tell's you how to move, aim, shoot, lock, etc. But I'd greatly enjoy actually knowing how to fly the thing that get's me to planet to planet.

Each planet is different, which is a given seeing as the game itself is about exploring. The colors really do give each floating space rock a personality.

4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Non recommandé
0.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 mars 2016
alright, so this sucked.
if you already know the main mechanic of the game (the mirrormoon) please note that there are no mouse controls.
if you don't, there's a sort of minimap in the sky that you can consult and is necessary to solve any puzzle.
except you can only consult this godly minimap when looking across the curvature of whichever planet you're on.
also note that the ship controls are confusing ("what the hell does this button do?") and there's no real tutorial ("WHAT THE HELL DOES THIS BUTTON DO?").
imagine going to a foreign country in which you don't speak the language and there's nobody there, so you have to follow signs that you don't understand and use systems that aren't familiar to you to accomplish a goal that's not really clear beyond "explore".


tl;dr don't buy. it's kinda gross.
if you want space + explore, save up and buy elite:dangerous
if you want puzzles, buy antichamber (also no tutorial, but that's a more fitting use of the "I'm lost" feeling)
if you really really want this game, have read the reviews, and accept this for its shortcomings, go ahead. but do not buy it for full price.
 
indie

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
